intro: Bremeria asperula, commonly known as the roughleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Bremeria asperula is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like hibiscus and cotton. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
